title: Relates to the medical examination and needs of children placed in foster care
summary: Relates to the medical examination and needs of children placed in foster care; requires that home health care agencies providing services to children in foster care provide a monthly report on the status of the child to the referring physician, the authorized foster care agency, and the foster parent.

       Introduced by M. of A. WRIGHT -- read once and referred to the Committee

       AN  ACT  to  amend the social services law and the public health law, in
         relation to the medical evaluation of children placed in foster care

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1. The social services law is amended by adding a new section
    2  383-d to read as follows:
    3    S 383-D. HOME CARE EVALUATIONS FOR FOSTER CARE CHILDREN. 1.  UPON  THE
    4  COMPLETION  OF A COMPREHENSIVE MEDICAL EXAMINATION OF THE CHILD, OR UPON
    5  A WAIVER OF SUCH EXAMINATION BY THE LOCAL SOCIAL SERVICES DISTRICT,  THE
    6  FOSTER  CARE  WORKER  ASSIGNED TO THE CHILD SHALL ASSIST THE FOSTER CARE
    7  PARENT IN ACQUIRING ANY SERVICES  DEEMED  MEDICALLY  NECESSARY  FOR  THE
    8  CHILD.
    9    2.  THE FOSTER PARENT MUST CONTINUE TO ALLOW FOR THE PROVISION OF SUCH
   10  SERVICES FOR THE FOSTER CARE CHILD UNTIL SUCH  TIME  AS  THE  AUTHORIZED
   11  AGENCY,  EXAMINING  PHYSICIAN, CERTIFIED HOME HEALTH AGENCY, OR LICENSED
   12  HOME CARE SERVICES AGENCY DETERMINES THAT SUCH SERVICES  ARE  NO  LONGER
   13  NECESSARY.
   14    S  2.  The public health law is amended by adding a new section 3620-a
   15  to read as follows:
   16    S 3620-A. HOME CARE SERVICES TO CHILDREN PLACED IN FOSTER CARE. 1. FOR
   17  PURPOSES OF THIS SECTION, THE  TERM  "HOME  HEALTH  CARE  AGENCY"  SHALL
   18  INCLUDE  BOTH  A  CERTIFIED  HOME HEALTH AGENCY AND A LICENSED HOME CARE
   19  SERVICES AGENCY.
   20    2. WHENEVER A HOME HEALTH CARE AGENCY  PERFORMS  AN  ASSESSMENT  OF  A
   21  CHILD  TO  BE  PLACED  IN FOSTER CARE, THE AGENCY MUST PROVIDE A COPY OF
   22  SUCH ASSESSMENT TO THE REFERRING PHYSICIAN, THE AUTHORIZED  FOSTER  CARE
   23  AGENCY, AND THE FOSTER PARENT.
   24    3. WHENEVER A HOME HEALTH CARE AGENCY PROVIDES SERVICES TO A CHILD WHO
   25  IS  IN  FOSTER  CARE,  SUCH  AGENCY MUST PROVIDE A MONTHLY REPORT ON THE

    1  PROGRESS AND DIAGNOSIS OF THE CHILD. SUCH REPORT SHALL  BE  PROVIDED  TO
    2  THE  REFERRING  PHYSICIAN,  THE  AUTHORIZED  FOSTER CARE AGENCY, AND THE
    3  FOSTER PARENT.
    4    4.  PRIOR  TO  DISCONTINUING ANY SERVICES, THE HOME HEALTH CARE AGENCY
    5  MUST INFORM THE FOSTER CHILD'S PHYSICIAN, THE FOSTER  CARE  WORKER,  AND
    6  THE FOSTER PARENT OF SUCH CHANGE AND THE REASON FOR THE CHANGE.
    7    S 3. This act shall take effect immediately.
